message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.SI 

This paper deals with combining distributional semantic representations with manually constructed lexical-semantic networks, which is a common topic in computational linguistics and natural language processing. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). Additionally, the paper involves machine learning techniques for disambiguation and alignment, which suggests the sub-categories cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also discusses the use of distributional information for knowledge acquisition tasks, which could fall under cs.IR (Information Retrieval) or cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
